item.name: Antidote Kit (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
An antidote kit contained a variety of wide-spectrum antidote hypospray injectors that were designed to neutralize all known poisons. A kit has five charges. As an action, you can administer a charge of the kit to cure a target of one poison affecting them or to give them advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to droids or constructs.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Aquatic Rebreather (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Aquatic breathers are breath masks designed to operate underwater. While worn, the wearer can breathe both air and water.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Armormech's Tools (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Armormech's tools include all of the necessary components to allow you to work raw materials to craft or repair damage to armor and shields.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Armstech's Tools (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Armstech's tools include all of the necessary components to allow you to work raw materials to craft or repair damage to blasters and vibroweapons.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Artificer's Tools (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Artificer's tools include all of the necessary components to allow you to craft and repair focus generators, holocrons, and lightweapons.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Assault Cannon (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: Energy
Properties: burst 4, reload 8, strength 15
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Astrotech's Tools (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Astrotech's tools include all of the necessary components to create droid customizations, assemble droids, and modify assembled droids.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Backpack (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Capacity: 1 cubic foot, 30 pounds of gear
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Bagpipes (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A musical instrument includes all of the necessary components to play it, as well as a few songs commonly performed with that instrument.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Bandfill (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A musical instrument includes all of the necessary components to play it, as well as a few songs commonly performed with that instrument.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Basic Poison (one dose) (Star Wars 5e)
item.text: Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Battle Armor (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Battle armor was constructed from a mesh of metal or composite plates and a padded jumpsuit. Variants of the armor included less plates and more padding for a lighter, though less protect-ive armor, and heavier plating with molded pieces to fit the wearer. Though the armor was available unmodified, most users personalized their armor.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Biochemist's Kit (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
This kit includes all of the necessary components to create and house standard adrenals, medpacs, and stimpacs. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to identify adrenals, medpacs, and stimpacs. Also, proficiency with this kit is required to create adrenals, medpacs, and stimpacs.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Biotech's Tools (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Biotech's tools include all of the necessary components to craft and install cybernetic augmentations in humanoids and beasts.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Blaster Cannon (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: auto, burst 2, reload 4, strength 15
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Blaster Carbine (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: Energy
Properties: reload 16
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

item.name: Blaster Pistol (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: Energy
Properties: reload 16
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Blaster Rifle (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: Energy
Properties: reload 12
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Bowcaster (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: Energy
Properties: burst 8, reload 8, strength 13
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Breaching Charge (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A device used to blow holes in larger constructs, a breaching charge creates a devastating explosion. Installing a breaching charge takes 1 minute. The charge can be set with a 6-second timer, or detonated remotely using a remote detonator.
Once detonated, the breaching charge destroys an unenhanced section of wall up to 10 feet wide, 10 feet tall, and 5 feet deep. Additionally, each creature within 20 feet of the charge must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 3d6 fire damage and 3d6 kinetic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A construct makes this save with disadvantage. If the breaching charge is installed on the construct, it automatically fails the saving throw.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Brewer's Tools (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Brewer's tools include includes all of the necessary components to ferment and store beer, as well as other illicit substances.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Carbonite Canister (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
When triggered, this wrist launcher ammunition produces a beam of carbonite energy in a 15 foot line. A single fuel canister holds enough fuel for three attacks. Each creature must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier) or take 1d6 cold damage and have its speed halved until the end of your next turn. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature is frozen in carbonite for 1 hour.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

item.name: Carpenter's Tools (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Carpenter's tools include all of the necessary components to build wooden furnitures and structures.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Chakram (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Properties: special When you throw a chakram or light ring, you can choose to have it return immediately to your hand. You must have one free hand to catch it.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Chance Cubes (Star Wars 5e)
item.text: Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Chef''s Kit (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
This kit includes all of the necessary implements to prepare and serve food to up to six people. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to identify food. Also, proficiency with this kit is required to create field rations.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Chest (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Capacity: 12 cubic feet/300 pounds of gear
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Claws
item.text:
Some species are naturally equipped by claws.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

item.name: Claws (1d4) (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Some species are naturally equipped with claws.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

item.name: Claws (1d6) (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Some species are naturally equipped with claws.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

item.name: Clothes, Common (Star Wars 5e)
item.text: Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Clothes, Costume (Star Wars 5e)
item.text: Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Clothes, Dress Uniform (Star Wars 5e)
item.text: Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Clothes, Fine (Star Wars 5e)
item.text: Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Clothes, Traveler's (Star Wars 5e)
item.text: Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Cobbler's Tools (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Cobbler's tools include all of the necessary components to construct and repair boots.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Code Cylinder (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Code cylinders are security devices in the shape of short cylinders that contain coded information about their bearers and grant them access to secure areas.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Combat suit (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Combat suits are seen all over the galaxy, and can be found for sale by almost any merchant who dealt in weapons and armor. Many such suits are used by military organizations, such as the Galactic Republic's military, as well as by mercenaries, criminals, bounty hunters and even some Jedi.
The suit itself offers decent protection from most types of attacks while maintaining maximum flexibility and minimum weight. However this armor is only recommended for light skirmishes.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Comm Jammer (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A comm jammer is a device used to scramble communications. A comm jammer can block transmissions from unenhanced communications devices in a 100 foot radius.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Commlink (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Commlinks are standard handheld communication devices, fitted with microphones and receivers. Standard, personal commlinks have a range of up to 30 miles, but are reduced in dense, urban areas or areas of high level interference.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Crate (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Capacity: 40 gallons liquid, 4 cubic feet solid
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Cybertech's Tools (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Cybertech's tools include all of the necessary components to modify and maintain datacrons, gadgets, and wristpads.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Dart, Wrist Launcher (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
This wrist launcher ammunition deals 1d6 kinetic damage on a hit.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Datacards (5) (Star Wars 5e)
item.text: Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Datacron (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A datacron is a type of holocron that can be accessed by non-Force-sensitives and are mainly used to store encrypted data. They are complete with an interactive projection to access the infor-mation.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Datapad (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A datapad is a small electronic device used for the input, storage and displaying of information. It features a holoprojective surface for 3D viewing.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Disruptor Pistol (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Properties: disintegrate, reload 1
Disintegrate: When a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by a weapon with the disintegrate property, it must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Disruptor Rifle (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Properties: disintegrate, reload 1
Disintegrate: When a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by a weapon with the disintegrate property, it must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Doubleblade (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Properties: Double (1d6 kinetic)
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Doublesaber (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: Double (1d8 energy), luminous
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Doubleshoto (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: Double (1d6 energy), luminous
Source Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

item.name: Doublesword (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Properties: Double (1d8 kinetic)
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Drum (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A musical instrument includes all of the necessary components to play it, as well as a few songs commonly performed with that instrument.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Durasteel armor (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Durasteel armor is an armor that reduced weight, but restricts movement. The armor is commony used by mercenaries, bounty hunters, soldiers, and civilians that live in dangerous areas.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: E-web Blaster (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: auto, burst
Rather than traditional power cells, the E-Web uses specialized power generator that allow it to fire continuously for 10 minutes. Replacing a battery pack takes an action.
The E-Web requires the use of a tripod, which is included in the price. Over the course of 1 minute, you can deploy or collapse the E-web on the tripod. While deployed, your speed is reduced to 0.
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Electrostaff (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Properties: Double (2d4 kinetic)
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Emergency Battery (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
All non-expendable droids need recharging as they are used. The battery has ten uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabilize a droid that has 0 hit points, without needing to make an Intelligence (Technology* (Religion)) check.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Enviro-suit (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Environment suits, atmospheric suits, or EVA suits, are pressure suits that enabled wearers to survive and operate in zero gravity space and other dangerous conditions.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Flame Projector Canister (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
When triggered, this wrist launcher ammunition produces a burst of flame in a 15 foot line or cone. A single fuel canister holds enough fuel for three attacks in a line or a single attack in a cone. Each creature must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier) or take 2d6 fire damage.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Flight Suit (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Flight suits, or jumpsuits, are a type of outfit worn by pilots. They are worn in conjunction with flight helmets. They come in a variety of different colors and provide life support, and protect from hostile environments.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Flute (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A musical instrument includes all of the necessary components to play it, as well as a few songs commonly performed with that instrument.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Greatsaber (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: energy:
Properties: luminous
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Grenade Launcher (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Properties: reload 1, strength 13
Rather than traditional power cells, the grenade launcher fires grenades. When firing a grenade at long range, creatures within the radius of the grenade's explosion have advantage on the saving throw.
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Grenade, Electrostun (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Electrostun grenades are usually used when the object of a mission is to detain, capture, or subdue rather than kill. Grenades have a range equal to 30 feet + your Strength modifier x 5. As an action, you can throw a grenade at a point you can see within range. Each creature within 10 feet must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 1d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. Additionally, on a failed save, the creature is stunned until the end of its next turn.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Grenade, Frag (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Frag grenades are cheap, low-damage grenades used mainly by military personnel, mercenaries, bounty hunters, and adventurers. Grenades can be set to detonate on impact or set with a timer that lasts several seconds before detonating. Grenades have a range equal to 30 feet + your Strength modifier x 5. As an action, you can throw a grenade at a point you can see within range. Each creature within 10 feet must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 2d6 kinetic damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Grenade, Gas (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Gas grenades are primarily used to flush enemies out of cover and other protected areas, though there are of course other uses. Grenades have a range equal to 30 feet + your Strength modifier x 5. As an action, you can throw a grenade at a point you can see within range. The grenade explodes in a 15ft radius sphere of yellow-green fog centered on a point you choose within range. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for 1 minute or until a wind of at least 10 miles per hour disperses it.
When a creature enters the fog's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. The creature takes 1d8 poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, on a failed save, the creature is poisoned while it is in the cloud. Droids, constructs and humanoids wearing appropriate protective equipment are uneffected.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Grenade, Ion (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Ion grenades are hand-held explosive devices that release a blast of ion energy. Grenades have a range equal to 30 feet + your Strength modifier x 5. As an action, you can throw a grenade at a point you can see within range. Each creature within 10 feet must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 2d4 ion damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. Any electronics within the blast radius are disabled until rebooted.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Headcomm (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A headcomm can be installed in a helmet or worn independently. It functions as a hands-free commlink.
Standard, personal commlinks have a range of up to 30 miles, but are reduced in dense, urban areas or areas of high level interference.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Heavy combat suit (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
The heavy combat suit is a type of armor that offers more protection than the basic model of combat suit. The heavy combat suit is heavier overall than other combat suits, and not quite as flexible, but many consider the trade-offs worthwhile. It is a good source of defense from physical attacks and light blaster fire.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Heavy durasteel armor (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Heavy durasteel armor is virtually the heaviest armor acquirable during the Galactic War. It is ideal for extreme combat situations that involved direct damage and also offers a very good level of protection in sacrifice of dexterity. Some consider it claustrophobic but that was the trade-off for safety.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Heavy Pistol (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: reload 12, strength 13
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Heavy Repeater (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: auto, burst 2, reload 8, strength 15
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Heavy shield (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Rather than an energy shield, heavy shields are physical composites of metal or plastic. They are much larger and more cumbersome, but they offer more protection than their smaller counterparts. Its cumbersome size, however, makes it unwieldy, and requires the use of a one-handed weapon with the light property in the other hand.
Small creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls while wielding a heavy shield. A heavy shield's size and bulk make it too large for a Small creature to use effectively.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Heavy Shotgun (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Properties: burst 2, reload 12, strength 13
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Hidden Blade (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Properties: hidden, special
A hidden blade does not fill the hand slot, but you can't use a hidden blade while the hand is full. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength saving throws to avoid being disarmed.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Hold-out (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: Energy
Properties: hidden, reload 6
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

item.name: Holochess Set (Star Wars 5e)
item.text: Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Holocomm (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A holocomm is a communications unit that utilizes the HoloNet. It enables users to send and receive messages through holographic-based transmission networks.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Holocron (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Holocrons are information-storage devices used by force wielders that contain ancient lessons or valuable information in holographic form. They appear as palm-sized, glowing polyhedrons of crystalline material and hardware, and can only be activated and used through the power of the Force.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Holorecorder (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A holorecorder is a device used to record and project holograms. Some droid models are equipped with internal holorecorders.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Holotrace Device (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A holotrace device is a wrist-worn gadget that can be used to trace a holographic transmission back to its source.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Horn (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A musical instrument includes all of the necessary components to play it, as well as a few songs commonly performed with that instrument.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Incinerator Sniper (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Properties: disintegrate, reload 4, strength 13
Disintegrate: When a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by a weapon with the disintegrate property, it must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it dies immediately without making death saving throws. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. A creature destroyed in this way can not be revitalized.
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Ion Blaster (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: ion
Properties: reload 16
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Ion Carbine (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Damage: Ion
Properties: reload 16
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Ion Carbine (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Damage: ion
Properties: reload 16
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Ion Rifle (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: ion
Properties: Ammunition (range 100/400), reload 12
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: IWS (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Properties: Special, strength 13, two-handed The IWS is a heavy weapon that can fire in three different modes. As a bonus action, you can switch between each mode, detailed below. Each mode contains and uses its own power source.
Antiarmor: While in this mode, rather than traditional power cells, the IWS fires grenades. When firing a grenade at long range, creatures within the radius of the grenade's explosion have advantage on the saving throw.
Blaster: While in this mode, the weapon uses traditional power cells.
Sniper: While in this mode, the weapon uses traditional power cells.
Antiarmor: Special, Ammunition (range 60/240), reload 1, special Blaster: 1d8 Energy, Ammunition (range 80/320), reload 12 Sniper: 1d12 Energy, Ammunition (range 120/480), reload 4
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Jeweler's Tools (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Jeweler's tools include all of the necessary components to identify and refine gemstones.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Light battle armor (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Providing solid protection for a minimal cost, light battle armor is considered excellent protection for entrenched troops or guards. However, this protection comes at a cost of mobility, limiting its uses by rapidly advancing infantry. Still, it provides more mobility than full battle armor.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Light Pistol (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: Energy
Properties: reload 20
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Light Repeater (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: auto, burst 4, reload 12
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Light Ring (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: hidden, luminous, special
When you throw a light ring, you can choose to have it return immediately to your hand. You must have one free hand to catch it.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Light shield generator (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A light shield generator is generally affixed to the forearm or belt. While a light shield does not fill the hand slot, you gain no benefit from it while the hand is full. You gain no benefit from a light shield while wielding a weapon with the heavy property.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Lightbow (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: reload 4, strength 13
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Lightdagger (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: energu
Properties: hidden, luminous
Source Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

item.name: Lightfoil (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: Finesse, hidden, luminous
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Lightsaber (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: Hidden, luminous
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Lightsaber Pike (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: Heavy, luminous, reach
Source (Star Wars 5e) Player's Handbook
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

item.name: Lute (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A musical instrument includes all of the necessary components to play it, as well as a few songs commonly performed with that instrument.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Martial Lightsaber (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: Hidden, luminous
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Mason's Tools (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Mason's tools include all of the necessary components to build structures from stone and metal.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Medium shield generator (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A personal shield generator was a defensive technology that projected a field of energy that protected the user from blaster fire, the elements, or other hazards. Most were designed to be held much like a traditional physical shield. The medium shield generator is used in conjunction with any one-handed weapon.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Medkit (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A common medkit can be stocked with bacta packs, and contains spray-bandages, bone stabilizers, antiseptics, and other essentials for the treatment of wounds. As an action, you can expend a use of the kit to stabilize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check. A medkit can be used to stabilize 5 times before it must be restocked at its original cost.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Medpac (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A medpac is a quick-acting syringe filled with a concentrated dose of kolto. As an action, you can use this medpac to restore 2d4+2 hit points to a creature within 5 feet.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Mine, Fragmentation (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
When you use your action to set it, this mine sets an imperceptible laser line extending up to 15 feet. When the laser is tripped, the mine explodes, and each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d6 kinetic damage, or half as much on a successful one.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Mine, Plasma (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
When you use your action to set it, this mine sets an imperceptible laser line extending up to 15 feet. When the laser is tripped, the mine explodes, coating the area in a 15-foot radius around it in fire that burns for 1 minute. When a creature enters the fire or starts its turn there it must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d6 fire damage, or half as much on a successful one. A construct makes this save with disadvantage.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Missile, Fragmentation (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
This wrist launcher ammunition deals 1d6 kinetic damage on a hit. Additionally, hit or miss, the missile then explodes. The target and each creature within 5 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier), taking 1d6 kinetic damage on a failed save.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Needler (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Properties: reload 20
The needler includes a specialized compartment for poison. One dose of poison, when installed in this compartment, retains its potency for 1 hour before drying. One dose of poison is effective for the next 10 shots fired by the weapon.
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Net (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Properties: Light, special, thrown (range 15)
A Large or smaller creature hit by an net is restrained until it is freed. An net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 kinetic or energy damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net.
When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

item.name: Ommni box (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A musical instrument includes all of the necessary components to play it, as well as a few songs commonly performed with that instrument.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Painter's Tools (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Painter's tools include all of the necessary components to paint and store art.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Pan Flute (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A musical instrument includes all of the necessary components to play it, as well as a few songs commonly performed with that instrument.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Pazaak Deck (Star Wars 5e)
item.text: Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Plasma Cell (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A plasma cell is a specialized power cell for use with blaster weapons. The loaded weapon deals fire damage instead of energy, and when you hit with a shot it sets the ground beneath it in a 5-foot square ablaze. When a creature enters the fire or starts its turn there it must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 1d6 fire damage.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Pocket Scrambler (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A pocket scrambler is a simple add-on to any commlink that automatically encodes any messages sent out. The transmitted message can only be read by a device equipped with a matched scrambler.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Pouch (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Capacity: 1/5 cubic foot/6 pounds of goods
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Power Cell (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Power cells energize blaster weapons and tools.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Power Generator (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Power generators energize the E-web blaster.
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Powered battle armor (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Powered battle armor is a type of armored suit that boosted the abilities of its wearer while offering good protection against most types of weapons. The micro-hydraulics of this type of powered armor provide the operator with both protection and strength enhancement. This type of armor is rarely seen outside of professional mercenaries' and soldiers' use.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Powered durasteel armor (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Powered durasteel armor uses the base durasteel armor, with the benefit of micro-hydraulics that boost the efficacy of the operator. It offers better protection, but increased weight.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Projector Tank, Carbonite (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
A carbonite projector tank is a type of ammunition for the vapor projector. When triggered, it produces a beam of carbonite energy in a 15 foot cone. Each creature must make a Constitution saving throw or take 2d6 cold damage and have its speed halved until the end of your next turn. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature is frozen in carbonite for 1 hour.
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Projector Tank, Flame (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
A flame projector tank is a type of ammunition for the vapor projector. When triggered, it produces a burst of flame in a 15 foot cone. Each creature must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 3d6 fire damage.
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Repair Kit (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A repair kit included the basic tools needed to repair a droid after being damaged in combat. The kit has three uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to restore 2d4+2 hit points to a droid or construct within 5 feet.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Respirator (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A respirator, or breath mask, is a portable device that allowed an oxygen-breather to survive in low-oxygen atmospheres. Although not suitable for use in outer-space, these hands-free masks were essential equipment for deep-space travel that might require activity outside of a starship.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Rocket Launcher (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Properties: reload 1, strength 15
Rather than traditional power cells, the rocket launcher fires specialized projectiles in the form of rockets.
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Rocket, Fragmentation (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
The fragmentation rocket is the most common ammunition type for the rocket launcher. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 kinetic damage. Hit or miss, the rocket then explodes. The target and each creature within 10 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier), taking 3d6 kinetic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a succesful one.
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Rocket, Ion (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
The ion rocket is a specialized ammunition type for the rocket launcher. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 kinetic damage. Hit or miss, the rocket then explodes. The target and each creature within 10 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier), taking 3d4 ion damage on a failed save, or half as much on a succesful one. Any electronics within the blast radius that aren't being worn or carried are disabled until rebooted.
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Rocket, plasma (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
The plasma rocket is a specialized ammunition type for the rocket launcher. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 kinetic damage. Hit or miss, the rocket then explodes, coating the area in a 15-foot radius around it in fire that burns for 1 minute. When a creature enters the fire or starts its turn there it must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier), taking 2d6 fire damage, or half as much on a successful one. A construct makes this save with disadvantage.
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Sabaac Deck (Star Wars 5e)
item.text: Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Saberspear (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: Luminous
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Saberwhip (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: hidden, luminous
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Scattergun (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: Kinetic
Properties: burst 2, reload 2
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

item.name: Scattergun (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Properties: burst 2, reload 2
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

item.name: Shawm (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A musical instrument includes all of the necessary components to play it, as well as a few songs commonly performed with that instrument.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Shotgun (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: Kinetic
Properties: burst 2, reload 4, strength 13
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Shotosaber (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: hidden, luminous
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Slugpistol (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Slugthrower (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Properties: burst 6, reload 12
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Sniper Rifle (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: Energy
Properties: reload 4, strength 13
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Sonic Pistol (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Damage: sonic
Properties: reload 16
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Sonic Rifle (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Damage: sonic
Properties: reload 12
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Stylus Pen (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A stylus pen is designed to write on both solid surfaces and touch screen interfaces.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Subrepeater (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Damage: energy
Properties: auto, burst 8, reload 16
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Surveyor's Tools (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Surveyor's tools include all of the necessary components to draw and store maps.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Synthweaver's Tools (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Synthweaver's tools include all of the necessary components to craft and repair clothing.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Techaxe (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Techblade (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Thermal Detonator (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Thermal detonators are palm-sized, spherical, and extremely deadly explosive weapons. In addition to being surprisingly powerful for their size, they can only be turned off by whoever turned them on. Thermal detonators have a range equal to 30 feet + your Strength modifier x 5. As an action, you can throw a grenade at a point you can see within range. Each creature within 10 feet must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 2d6 fire and 2d6 kinetic damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one. Additionally, on a failed save, the creature is knocked prone.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Thick Skull Strike (1d6) (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Your skull is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal 1d6 + your Strength modifier kinetic damage.
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

item.name: Tinker's Tools (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Tinker's tools include all of the necessary components to craft and repair augments, barriers, and minor trinkets.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Vapor Projector (Star Wars 5e EC)
item.text:
Properties: Ammunition (range special), reload 5, special, strength 13, two-handed
The vapor projector does not make attack rolls. Rather than traditional power cells, the vapor projector uses specialized projector tanks, which, when fired, spray an area with the contents of the tank. Projector tanks require your target to make a saving throw to resist the tank's effects. The DC for this saving throw is 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).
Source: Star Wars 5e Expanded Content

item.name: Vibroaxe (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Vibrobaton (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Vibroblade (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Vibrodagger (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Vibrodart (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Due to their diminutive size, vibrodarts make ineffective melee weapons. Melee attack rolls made with them are made at disadvantage.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Vibroknuckler (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Sourcem Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook
Source: Star Wars 5e v0.9.1 (Homebrew)

item.name: Vibrolance (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
You have disadvantage when you use a vibrolance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Vibromace (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Vibropike (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Vibrorapier (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Vibrospear (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Vibrostaff (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Vibrosword (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Vibrowhip (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Damage: kinetic
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Viol (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A musical instrument includes all of the necessary components to play it, as well as a few songs commonly performed with that instrument.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook [see also Star Wars 5e Wretched Hives]

item.name: Wrist launcher (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
Properties: reload 1, special
Rather than traditional power cells, the wrist launcher fires specialized projectiles in the form of darts, small missiles, or specialized canisters.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook

item.name: Wristpad (Star Wars 5e)
item.text:
A wristpad is a harness with an integrated datapad and holoprojector interface that fits on the forearm and includes self-charging battery packs.
Source: Star Wars 5e Player's Handbook
